### How to share clipboard info between host and VM

- Settings -> General -> Advanced -> change both "Shared Clipboard" and "Drag'n'Drop" to "Bidirectional", click OK :

<img src="./assets/shared_folder_VM.png" style="max-width:80%;">

- Clipboard copy-paste should work: copy a line from the host onto clipboard and paste into VM.

<img src="./assets/VM-sharing-clipboard1.png" style="max-width:50%;">
<img src="./assets/VM-sharing-clipboard2.png" style="max-width:50%;">

### How to create a shared folder

- On VM: Settings -> General -> Shared Folders -> plus sign:

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder1.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- Click on Folder Path:

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder2.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- Create a new folder (or choose existing one):

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder3.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- Name it "SharedDrive":

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder4.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- Click "Select Folder"

- Click "Auto-mount" and "Make Permanent":

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder5.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- Click OK.

- Now you have a line under "Machine Folders" on VM:

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder6.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- Click OK.

- On the host system, create a file "File1" in the SharedDrive folder:

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder7.png" style="max-width:50%;">

- On VM, create a directory on desktop and mount SharedDrive on it:

<img src="./assets/VM-sharng-folder8.png" style="max-width:80%;">
